<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Illusion Sense](/Feats.aspx?ID=31) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Gnome" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=80" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 44 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

Your ancestors spent their days cloaked and cradled in illusions, and as a result, sensing [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92) magic is second nature to you. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to both Perception checks and Will saves against illusions. When you come within 10 feet of an illusion that can be disbelieved, the GM rolls a [secret](/Traits.aspx?ID=142) check for you to disbelieve it, even if you didn't spend an action to Interact with the illusion.

<title level="2">Illusion Sense leads to...</title>
[Intuitive Illusions](/Feats.aspx?ID=996), [Natural Illusionist](/Feats.aspx?ID=997)
name: Illusion Sense
